en: The bridge is designed to open in the middle.
zh: 这座桥的设计是中间可以打开。

en: The bridge is being repaired.
zh: 这座桥正在维修。

en: The bridge will be completed by the end of this year.
zh: 这座桥将在今年年底前完工。

en: The bridge couldn't sustain the force of the strong current and collapsed.
zh: 这座桥无法承受强劲水流的冲击力而坍塌了。

en: The bridge is open to traffic.
zh: 这座桥已经通车了。

en: The bridge is safe; you can drive across.
zh: 这座桥很安全，你可以开车通过。

en: The bridge is one mile above.
zh: 这座桥在一英里以上的地方。

en: The bridge had been built before that time.
zh: 那座桥在那之前就已经建好了。

en: There is a waterfall above the bridge.
zh: 桥的上方有一个瀑布。

en: I saw a boat above the bridge.
zh: 我在桥的上方看到一艘船。

en: Do you know the man standing on the bridge?
zh: 你认识站在桥上的那个人吗？

en: Don't cross a bridge till you come to it.
zh: 船到桥头自然直。

en: There is a cottage beyond the bridge.
zh: 桥的那边有一间小屋。

en: Bids were invited for building the bridge.
zh: 已经邀请投标建造这座桥。

en: There is a hut below the bridge.
zh: 桥的下面有一间小屋。

en: Don't cross your bridges before you come to them.
zh: 不要杞人忧天。

en: It was dark under the bridge.
zh: 桥下很黑。

en: Several bridges have been damaged or swept away.
zh: 几座桥梁已经损坏或被冲走。

en: A bridge gives access to the island.
zh: 一座桥可以通往该岛屿。

en: The bridge crashed under the pressure.
zh: 桥在压力下坍塌了。

en: With the bridge destroyed, there was nothing to do but swim.
zh: 桥被毁了，除了游泳别无他法。

en: In culture, they are on the same plane as savages.
zh: 在文化方面，他们和野蛮人处于同一水平。

en: As is often the case with educated people, he likes classical music better than jazz.
zh: 受过教育的人通常都是这样，他更喜欢古典音乐而不是爵士乐。

en: The fact that educated Americans in general no longer share understandable background knowledge is a chief cause of their inability to communicate effectively.
zh: 受过教育的美国人普遍不再拥有可以理解的背景知识，这一事实是他们无法有效沟通的主要原因。

en: Teaching is a profession of my own choosing.
zh: 教学是我自己选择的职业。

en: My driving instructor says I should be more patient.
zh: 我的驾驶教练说我应该更有耐心。

en: The faculty meeting adopted the dean's proposal.
zh: 教职工会议通过了院长的提案。

en: The professor seemed to be lost in thought.
zh: 那位教授似乎陷入了沉思。

en: The professor treated her as one of his students.
zh: 那位教授把她当成了自己的学生之一。

en: The professor gave a lecture on the Middle East.
zh: 那位教授做了一场关于中东的讲座。

en: The professor ordered some new books from New York.
zh: 那位教授从纽约订购了一些新书。

en: The professor scolded John for skipping class.
zh: 那位教授因为约翰逃课而责骂了他。

en: The professor made sure the test was checked carefully.
zh: 那位教授确保试卷被仔细检查过。

en: The professor encouraged me in my studies.
zh: 那位教授鼓励我学习。

en: The professor is in Japan on sabbatical leave.
zh: 那位教授正在日本休学术假。

en: Our professor promised to hold off on the final exam for another week.
zh: 我们的教授答应把期末考试推迟一周。

en: The professor requires excellent work of his students.
zh: 那位教授要求他的学生们做到尽善尽美。

en: The professor teaches English conversation.
zh: 那位教授教英语会话。

en: The professor lectured on French history.
zh: 那位教授讲授了法国历史。

en: The professor smiled.
zh: 那位教授笑了。

en: The professor solved the problem at last.
zh: 那位教授最终解决了这个问题。

en: The professor thought it rude to say such a thing.
zh: 那位教授认为说那样的话很粗鲁。

en: Can you take notes for me during the professor's talk?
zh: 你能在教授讲课时帮我做笔记吗？

en: The professor's speech was full of humor.
zh: 那位教授的演讲充满了幽默。

en: The professor's boring lecture put me to sleep.
zh: 那位教授枯燥的讲座让我昏昏欲睡。

en: Our professor paid the bill for all of us.
zh: 我们的教授为我们所有人付了账单。

en: It was ordered that the classroom be put in order.
zh: 有人下令要整理好教室。

en: Keep your classroom clean.
zh: 保持教室清洁。

en: The classroom was full of pupils.
zh: 教室里挤满了学生。

en: The classroom has finally warmed up.
zh: 教室终于暖和起来了。

en: Line up the desks in the classroom.
zh: 把教室里的桌子排好。

en: It is the students' duty to clean their classrooms.
zh: 打扫教室是学生的义务。

en: There is a tall man in the classroom.
zh: 教室里有一个高个子男人。

en: Take off your hat when you enter a classroom.
zh: 进入教室时，请摘下你的帽子。

en: As soon as he entered the classroom, our teacher burst into angry speech.
zh: 他一走进教室，我们的老师就怒气冲冲地开始讲话。

en: I found that I had left my umbrella behind in the classroom.
zh: 我发现我把伞忘在教室里了。

en: There was an expensive camera left in the classroom.
zh: 教室里留下了一个昂贵的相机。

en: The children ran toward the classroom.
zh: 孩子们朝教室跑去。

en: There were few students left in the classroom.
zh: 教室里几乎没有学生了。

en: There were few children in the classroom.
zh: 教室里几乎没有孩子了。

en: There were some students in the classroom.
zh: 教室里有一些学生。

en: There were few students remaining in the classroom.
zh: 教室里剩下没几个学生了。

en: I wish our classroom were air-conditioned.
zh: 我希望我们的教室有空调。

en: You must not make noises in the classroom.
zh: 你不能在教室里发出噪音。

en: Do you eat it in the classroom?
zh: 你在教室里吃它吗？

en: Your hat should not be worn in the classroom.
zh: 你的帽子不应该在教室里戴。

en: Don't you talk in the classroom.
zh: 不要在教室里说话。

en: Get out of the classroom.
zh: 滚出教室。

en: The teachers are trying to motivate their students.
zh: 老师们正在努力激励他们的学生。

en: The teacher is likely to get angry with the students.
zh: 老师很可能会对学生生气。

en: The teacher often emphasizes that students should have courage.
zh: 老师经常强调学生应该有勇气。

en: The teacher exhorted his pupils to do well.
zh: 老师劝诫他的学生们要好好学习。

en: The teacher caught the student cheating on the examination.
zh: 老师抓住了那个在考试中作弊的学生。

en: Teachers shouldn't fall back on their authority.
zh: 老师不应该滥用他们的权威。

en: Teachers should give their children the faith that tomorrow will be brighter and happier.
zh: 老师应该给孩子们相信明天会更光明更幸福的信念。

en: Teachers must understand children.
zh: 老师必须了解孩子。

en: A teacher should never laugh at his students' mistakes.
zh: 老师不应该嘲笑学生的错误。

en: The teacher gave way to the students' demand.
zh: 老师让步于学生的要求。

en: The teacher had to evaluate all the students.
zh: 老师必须评估所有的学生。

en: Teachers stimulate the students' interest, have them think, ask questions, and debate among themselves.
zh: 老师激发学生的兴趣，让他们思考、提问，并在他们之间进行辩论。

en: The teacher accused one of his students of being noisy in class.
zh: 老师指责他的一个学生在课堂上吵闹。

en: The teacher was worried by Tom's frequent absence from class.
zh: 汤姆经常旷课，这让老师很担心。

en: Teachers should occasionally let their students blow off some steam.
zh: 老师应该偶尔让学生们放松一下。

en: Teachers should treat all their students impartially.
zh: 老师应该公正地对待所有的学生。

en: Although teachers give a lot of advice, students don't always take it.
zh: 虽然老师给很多建议，但学生并不总是听取。

en: A teacher should never make fun of a pupil who makes a mistake.
zh: 老师不应该取笑犯错的学生。

en: The salary of a teacher is lower than that of a lawyer.
zh: 老师的工资比律师的低。

en: You should be respectful to your teachers.
zh: 你应该尊重你的老师。

en: I intended to have been a teacher.
zh: 我本打算当一名老师。

en: I have been a teacher for 15 years.
zh: 我当老师已经15年了。

en: Patience is essential for a teacher.
zh: 耐心对老师来说至关重要。

en: It is not fitting for a teacher to overly favor certain pupils over others.
zh: 老师不应该过分偏袒某些学生。

en: A student raised his hand when the teacher finished the reading.
zh: 老师读完后，一个学生举起了手。

en: When the teacher is very strict, the students must mind their P's and Q's.
zh: 当老师非常严格时，学生们必须谨言慎行。

en: An ounce of practice is worth a pound of precept.
zh: 实践胜于雄辩。

en: The vicar often refers to the Bible in his sermon.
zh: 牧师经常在他的布道中引用圣经。

en: The instructor advised me to get exercise every day.
zh: 指导员建议我每天锻炼。

en: The church bells are ringing.
zh: 教堂的钟声正在敲响。

en: The church is on the hill overlooking the city.
zh: 教堂在俯瞰城市的山上。

en: The church sits on the outskirts of town.
zh: 教堂位于城镇的郊外。

en: Churches are designated on the map with crosses.
zh: 教堂在地图上用十字架标记。

en: The church is surrounded by woods and lakes.
zh: 教堂被树林和湖泊环绕。

en: The church is between my house and yours.
zh: 教堂在我家和你家之间。

en: The church is decorated with flowers for the wedding.
zh: 教堂装饰着鲜花，准备举办婚礼。

en: The church is at the foot of the hill.
zh: 教堂位于山脚下。

en: The church stood alone on the hill.
zh: 教堂独自矗立在山顶上。

en: The church is just across the street.
zh: 教堂就在街对面。

en: The clock in the church tower struck nine.
zh: 教堂塔楼上的钟敲了九下。

en: The church bell used to ring at three.
zh: 教堂的钟过去常常在三点钟敲响。

en: All the church bells started ringing together.
zh: 所有的教堂钟一起响了起来。

en: The church clock gains three minutes a week.
zh: 教堂的钟每周快三分钟。

en: The church congregation was moved by the fine sermon.
zh: 教堂的会众被精彩的布道所感动。

en: Let's pass by the church.
zh: 咱们从教堂旁边经过吧。

en: Go straight ahead until you reach the church.
zh: 一直往前走，直到你看到教堂。

en: Whoever goes to church believes in God.
zh: 凡是去教堂的人都信上帝。

en: There is usually an organ in a church.
zh: 教堂里通常有一台管风琴。

en: Rituals were performed in churches.
zh: 仪式在教堂里举行。

en: Churches were erected all over the island.
zh: 教堂在岛上各地建立起来。

en: You must not forget your schoolbooks.
zh: 你千万不要忘记你的课本。

en: Listen to me with your textbooks closed.
zh: 合上课本，听我说。

en: Where do we get the textbooks?
zh: 我们从哪里得到课本？

en: You must read the textbook closely.
zh: 你必须仔细阅读课本。

en: Each chapter in the textbook is followed by about a dozen comprehension questions.
zh: 课本的每一章后面都有大约十几个理解问题。

en: Open your texts to page 50.
zh: 把书翻到第50页。

en: The educational system is in transition.
zh: 教育系统正在转型。

en: People want more money to expand educational institutions.
zh: 人们希望有更多的资金来扩建教育机构。

en: And I call on the chairman of the Education Committee to support the motion.
zh: 我呼吁教育委员会主席支持这项动议。

en: The local school board would go to any length to ban that book.
zh: 当地学校董事会将不惜一切代价来禁止那本书。

en: The Board of Education governs the schools.
zh: 教育委员会管理学校。

en: Education is one of the most essential aspects of life.
zh: 教育是生活中最重要的方面之一。

en: Education is an investment in the future.
zh: 教育是对未来的投资。

en: Education does not consist simply in learning a lot of facts.
zh: 教育不仅仅在于学习大量的知识。

en: Education aims to develop potential abilities.
zh: 教育旨在发展潜在的能力。

en: Education helps to mold character.
zh: 教育有助于塑造性格。

en: Education is the agent of progress.
zh: 教育是进步的推动力。

en: Education is a critical element.
zh: 教育是一个关键要素。

en: Education must not be limited to our youth, but it must be a continuing process through our entire lives.
zh: 教育不应仅限于我们的青年，而应是我们整个生命中持续不断的过程。

en: Education starts at home.
zh: 教育始于家庭。

en: Education shouldn't be aimed at passing a test.
zh: 教育的目的不应该是为了通过考试。

en: The goal of education is not wealth or status, but personal development.
zh: 教育的目标不是财富或地位，而是个人发展。

en: Education should be carried further than it is now.
zh: 教育应该比现在更进一步。

en: It is impossible to exaggerate the importance of education.
zh: 教育的重要性无论怎么强调都不为过。

en: What is the ultimate purpose of education?
zh: 教育的最终目的是什么？

en: Educational reforms still have a long way to go.
zh: 教育改革还有很长的路要走。

en: The value of education cannot be overemphasized.
zh: 教育的价值无论怎么强调都不为过。

en: My education has made me what I am.
zh: 我的教育造就了今天的我。

en: One of the great superstitions about education is that learning is the result of teaching.
zh: 关于教育的一个最大的迷信是，学习是教学的结果。

en: More money for education will spur economic growth.
zh: 增加教育投入将刺激经济增长。

en: Examinations play a large part in education.
zh: 考试在教育中扮演着重要的角色。

en: Education doesn't consist of learning a lot of facts.
zh: 教育不仅仅在于学习大量的知识。

en: Education means something more than going to school.
zh: 教育的意义不仅仅是上学。

en: Education should not be a burden on the parents as well as on the children.
zh: 教育不应该成为父母和孩子的负担。

en: Teaching is learning.
zh: 教学相长。

en: Teaching asks for a lot of patience.
zh: 教学需要很大的耐心。

en: With teaching and studying my time is taken up.
zh: 我所有的时间都用来教学和学习了。

en: They learn to do without being taught.
zh: 他们无师自通。

en: Where did you go for that 30 minutes you were gone?
zh: 你刚才消失的那三十分钟去哪儿了？

en: Thank you for the information.
zh: 谢谢你的信息。

en: Kyoko went away, humming a song.
zh: 京子哼着歌走了。

en: Dinosaurs are now extinct.
zh: 恐龙现在已经灭绝了。

en: Fear always springs from ignorance.
zh: 恐惧总是源于无知。

en: Fear robbed him of speech.
zh: 恐惧使他失去了说话的能力。

en: His legs were trembling from fear.
zh: 他的腿因恐惧而颤抖。

en: Sorry, but can you show me the way to the next village?
zh: 不好意思，请问去下一个村庄怎么走？

en: May I make so bold as to request your assistance?
zh: 我可以冒昧地请求您的帮助吗？

en: Will you kindly come here at nine?
zh: 请您九点到这里来好吗？

en: I am very sorry, but I must cancel our appointment for February 27.
zh: 非常抱歉，我必须取消2月27日的约会。

en: I'm afraid you have to work overtime.
zh: 恐怕你得加班了。

en: The victim of blackmail has been paying hush money for years, but now he realizes it is foolish, and he has decided not to pay a red cent more.
zh: 勒索的受害者多年来一直在支付封口费，但现在他意识到这是愚蠢的，他决定不再支付一分钱。

en: Fear crept into my heart and settled there.
zh: 恐惧悄悄地进入我的内心并扎根在那里。

en: It's awfully cold today.
zh: 今天真是太冷了。

en: It's awfully cold this evening.
zh: 今天晚上真是太冷了。

en: A fearful thought entered my mind.
zh: 一个可怕的想法进入了我的脑海。

en: A terrible fate awaited him.
zh: 一个可怕的命运在等待着他。

en: Would you please open the window?
zh: 请你打开窗户好吗？

en: Move over a little if you please.
zh: 请您稍微挪动一下。

en: Would you be kind enough to explain it to me?
zh: 您能好心给我解释一下吗？

en: Sorry, we're full today.
zh: 对不起，我们今天客满了。

en: Would you mind opening the window?
zh: 您介意打开窗户吗？

en: Would you be so kind as to post my letter?
zh: 您能帮我寄一下这封信吗？

en: I'm sorry, but he isn't home.
zh: 很抱歉，他不在家。

en: Please make certain your seat belt is fastened.
zh: 请务必系好安全带。

en: Excuse me, but let me have another look at the photo.
zh: 打扰一下，请让我再看一眼照片。

en: Don't be afraid.
zh: 别害怕。

en: It will be fine weather tomorrow, perhaps.
zh: 明天也许会是好天气。

en: She is probably over forty.
zh: 她大概四十多岁了。

en: It is probable that he will win the speech contest.
zh: 他很可能会赢得演讲比赛。

en: I am afraid to jump over the ditch.
zh: 我害怕跳过这条沟。

en: The bold man glanced at the gangster with hatred and contempt.
zh: 那个大胆的人带着憎恨和轻蔑瞥了那个歹徒一眼。

en: The heat is intense.
zh: 天气非常炎热。

en: There's nothing to be afraid of.
zh: 没什么好害怕的。

en: Mr. Satoyama's work made a big impression in the world of haiku.
zh: 里山先生的作品在俳句界引起了很大的反响。

en: Flying against a strong wind is very difficult.
zh: 逆风飞行非常困难。

en: The strong wind died away at night.
zh: 强风在夜里减弱了。

en: Strong winds stripped the tree of its leaves.
zh: 强风把树上的叶子都吹掉了。

en: The strong wind indicates that a storm is coming.
zh: 强风预示着暴风雨即将来临。

en: Passing through the strong wind, the planes rock like this, but don't worry.
zh: 穿过强风时，飞机这样摇晃，但别担心。

en: The strong wind cut the electric wires in several places.
zh: 强风在几个地方切断了电线。

en: They say we're going to get high winds.
zh: 他们说我们要刮大风了。

en: Fanned by a strong wind, the fire spread in an instant.
zh: 在强风的助长下，火势瞬间蔓延开来。

en: We got our roof blown off in the gale.
zh: 我们的屋顶被大风刮掉了。

en: A strong wind began to set in.
zh: 开始刮起强风了。

en: The wind blew in gusts.
zh: 风一阵阵地吹。

en: Tall buildings may sway in a strong wind.
zh: 高层建筑可能会在强风中摇晃。

en: There was a strong wind.
zh: 当时刮着强风。

en: The thieves knocked off another bank today in a daytime robbery.
zh: 今天白天，窃贼又抢劫了一家银行。

en: The robbers fell on him from behind the trees.
zh: 强盗从树后向他扑去。

en: The robber attacked her on a back street.
zh: 强盗在一条小巷里袭击了她。

en: The burglar locked the couple in the basement.
zh: 窃贼把这对夫妇锁在了地下室里。

en: The robber bashed her head in.
zh: 强盗猛击她的头部。

en: The thief forced her to hand over the money.
zh: 小偷强迫她交出钱。

en: The burglar broke into the post office in broad daylight.
zh: 窃贼在光天化日之下闯入了邮局。

en: The robber aimed his gun at the clerk.
zh: 强盗用枪指着店员。

en: The burglar tied my hands behind my back with a rope.
zh: 窃贼用绳子把我的手绑在背后。

en: The robber aimed his gun at the police officer.
zh: 强盗用枪指着警察。

en: The robbers made away with all the money in the safe.
zh: 强盗抢走了保险柜里的所有钱。

en: The cat burglar must have entered the mansion from the roof.
zh: 飞贼一定是爬上屋顶进入豪宅的。

en: The burglar was traced by one of the things he had left on the scene.
zh: 窃贼因为留在现场的东西而被追踪到。

en: The burglar shut the child in the closet.
zh: 窃贼把孩子关进了壁橱里。

en: The robber seized the bag from his hand.
zh: 强盗从他手中抢走了包。

en: Robbers wrecked the mail train.
zh: 强盗破坏了邮车。

en: The burglars broke into the bank at night.
zh: 窃贼在夜间闯入了银行。

en: The robbers fell on her there.
zh: 强盗在那里袭击了她。

en: The burglar burst into his house.
zh: 窃贼闯入了他的房子。

en: A burglar broke into his house.
zh: 窃贼闯入了他的房子。

en: A burglar broke into the bank last night.
zh: 昨晚有个窃贼闯入了银行。

en: A thief broke into the house to steal the money.
zh: 一个小偷闯入房子偷钱。

en: Have you heard that a burglar broke into my neighbor's house?
zh: 你有没有听说过有个窃贼闯入了我邻居的房子？

en: As long as there are sovereign nations possessing great power, war is inevitable.
zh: 只要存在拥有强大主权的国家，战争就不可避免。

en: The slugger was easily put out.
zh: 那个强击手很容易就被淘汰了。

en: The strong will survive and the weak will die.
zh: 强者生存，弱者死亡。

en: The strong must help the weak.
zh: 强者必须帮助弱者。

en: The strong should take care of the weak.
zh: 强者应该照顾弱者。

en: The aggressive salesman urged me to sign the contract right away.
zh: 那个咄咄逼人的推销员催促我立即签署合同。

en: Bite down tightly, please.
zh: 请紧紧咬住。

en: The sail tightened in the strong wind.
zh: 帆在强风中绷紧了。

en: A strong wind was blowing.
zh: 当时刮着强风。

en: A strong wind is blowing and I can't walk fast.
zh: 刮着强风，我走不快。

en: The strong winds were blowing.
zh: 当时刮着强风。

en: A strong wind arose.
zh: 刮起了一阵强风。

en: A strong wind blew all day long.
zh: 强风刮了一整天。

en: Due to the intense sunlight, his back was sunburnt.
zh: 由于强烈的阳光，他的背部被晒伤了。

en: The hot sun baked the ground dry.
zh: 炎热的太阳把地面晒干了。

en: The strong east wind lashed at our faces.
zh: 强劲的东风抽打着我们的脸。

en: No one but a strong man is fit for the post.
zh: 只有坚强的人才适合这个职位。

en: A strong yen is shaking the economy.
zh: 日元坚挺正在动摇经济。

en: I was drenched to the skin because of the heavy rain.
zh: 因为下大雨，我被淋透了。

en: It is hard to wake up without a strong cup of coffee.
zh: 没有一杯浓咖啡很难醒来。

en: The sound of shouting grew faint.
zh: 喊叫声越来越微弱。

en: You'll get a reward for your cooperation.
zh: 你会因为你的合作而得到奖励。

en: When you want cooperation, share over many hands.
zh: 想要合作，就要集思广益。

en: I'm willing to do the job if you cooperate.
zh: 如果你合作，我愿意做这份工作。

en: We can lift the restrictions on imports once the joint agreement is signed.
zh: 一旦联合协议签署，我们就可以解除对进口的限制。

en: There is very little probability of an agreement being reached.
zh: 达成协议的可能性很小。

en: The society made him president.
zh: 协会选举他为会长。

en: The association is still a far cry from being well organized.
zh: 该协会离组织良好还差得很远。

en: The society was founded in 1990.
zh: 该协会成立于1990年。

en: The fingerprints left on the weapon correspond with the suspect's.
zh: 留在武器上的指纹与嫌疑人的指纹相符。

en: A fanatic threw a bomb at the king's coach.
zh: 一个狂热分子向国王的马车扔了一枚炸弹。

en: The GOP accused the Democrats of pork barrel politics.
zh: 共和党指责民主党搞政治分肥。

en: A republic is a nation whose head is not a king or queen, but a president.
zh: 共和国是指国家元首不是国王或女王，而是总统的国家。

en: We suggested Kyoritsu Bussan approach you for assistance.
zh: 我们建议共立物产找您寻求帮助。

en: What's everybody's business is nobody's business.
zh: 人人都管的事，就是没人管的事。

en: They came to terms with each other on how to start a joint venture.
zh: 他们就如何开始合资企业达成了协议。

en: Two different parties with common interests were on the warpath when he cut in to settle the dispute.
zh: 当他介入以解决争端时，两个有共同利益的不同政党正处于战争状态。

en: Communism is the system practiced in the Soviet Union.
zh: 共产主义是苏联实行的制度。

en: Communism was the political system in the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics, but that stopped in 1993.
zh: 共产主义是苏维埃社会主义共和国联盟的政治制度，但这种情况在1993年停止了。

en: In communism, the means of production are owned by the state.
zh: 在共产主义中，生产资料归国家所有。

en: As communism has collapsed, capitalism is now accused of trying to "dominate the world."
zh: 随着共产主义的崩溃，资本主义现在被指责试图“统治世界”。

en: We will be willing to make a deal with you after the auction.
zh: 拍卖会结束后，我们愿意与您达成协议。

en: I obtained the painting at an auction.
zh: 我是在一次拍卖会上得到这幅画的。

en: Before the horse race begins, the jockeys grip the reins tightly to restrain the impatient horses.
zh: 在赛马开始之前，骑师紧紧抓住缰绳，以控制住焦躁不安的马匹。

en: With horse racing and such, these are called "stakes". For this meaning the plural form is often used.
zh: 像赛马这样的，这些被称为“赌注”。对于这个意思，通常使用复数形式。

en: I'm tickled pink about winning 10,000 yen at the horse races.
zh: 在赛马中赢了1万日元，我非常高兴。

en: I just lost at the races so I'm flat broke.
zh: 我赛马输了，所以身无分文了。

en: The horses are coming down the track and it's neck and neck.
zh: 赛马正在跑道上飞奔而来，现在是并驾齐驱。

en: Competition is not by nature evil.
zh: 竞争本身在本质上并非邪恶。

en: The competition has become fierce.
zh: 竞争已经变得非常激烈。

en: Having run the race, Jane had two glasses of barley tea.
zh: 跑完比赛后，简喝了两杯大麦茶。

en: Effectively dealing with competition is an important part of life.
zh: 有效地应对竞争是生活的重要组成部分。

en: He came in fifth in the race.
zh: 他在比赛中得了第五名。

en: Competition is neither good nor evil in itself.
zh: 竞争本身既不好也不坏。

en: Competition is not bad in itself.
zh: 竞争本身并没有什么不好。

en: How long does it take to get to the stadium?
zh: 到体育场要多久？

en: How did you get to the stadium?
zh: 你是怎么到体育场的？

en: The athlete was full of spirit and confidence.
zh: 这位运动员精神饱满，充满自信。

en: The athletic meeting went on as scheduled.
zh: 运动会如期举行。

en: Supply is relative to demand.
zh: 供给是相对于需求的。

en: Supplies cannot keep up with the demand.
zh: 供应跟不上需求。

en: The supply can not keep up with the demand.
zh: 供应跟不上需求。

en: Supply will soon overtake demand.
zh: 供应很快就会超过需求。

en: Your name was given to us by Mr. Hayashi of Keiyo Steel Corporation.
zh: 你的名字是庆阳钢铁株式会社的林先生告诉我们的。

en: Do you have a map of the city of Kyoto?
zh: 你有京都市的地图吗？

en: Will you tell me the way to Kyoto Station?
zh: 请你告诉我到京都车站怎么走好吗？

en: You should visit Kyoto.
zh: 你应该去京都看看。

en: You should visit Kyoto, which is famous for its old temples and shrines.
zh: 你应该去参观以古老的寺庙和神社而闻名的京都。

en: Kyoto is worth visiting.
zh: 京都是值得一游的。

en: Kyoto gets thousands of visitors from all over the world each year.
zh: 京都每年接待来自世界各地的数千名游客。

en: Kyoto is not as large as Osaka.
zh: 京都没有大阪那么大。

en: Kyoto gets lots of visitors from all over the world.
zh: 京都每年接待来自世界各地的大量游客。

en: Kyoto is famous for its shrines and temples.
zh: 京都以神社和寺庙而闻名。

en: Kyoto is most beautiful in autumn.
zh: 京都秋天最美。

en: Kyoto is most crowded when it is most beautiful.
zh: 京都最美的时候也最拥挤。

en: Kyoto is famous for its old temples.
zh: 京都以古老的寺庙而闻名。

en: Kyoto is internationally famous for its scenic beauty.
zh: 京都以其美丽的景色在国际上闻名。

en: Kyoto depends on the tourist industry.
zh: 京都依赖旅游业。

en: Kyoto was the former capital of Japan.

en: Kyoto is visited by many tourists.

en: Kyoto was an old capital of Japan.

en: How do you like Kyoto?

en: Kyoto is visited by many people every year.

en: Kyoto is worth visiting once.
zh: 京都是值得一游的。

en: The charm of Kyoto consists of the beauty of its old temples.
zh: 京都的魅力在于其古老寺庙的美丽。

en: There was an enormous traffic jam in downtown Kyoto.
zh: 京都市中心发生了严重的交通堵塞。

en: Are you from Kyoto?

en: Summers are very hot in Kyoto.
zh: 京都的夏天非常炎热。

en: Don't forget to give us a ring when you arrive in Kyoto.
zh: 你到达京都的时候，别忘了给我们打个电话。

zh: 我住在京都的时候，他担任我的导游。

en: I would often visit the museum when I lived in Kyoto.

en: There are many famous old buildings in Kyoto.
zh: 京都有很多著名的古老建筑。

en: A heavy snow fell in Kyoto for the first time in ages.

en: There are many places to visit in Kyoto.
zh: 京都有很多值得参观的地方。

en: Kyoto has many universities.
zh: 京都有很多大学。

en: There are many shrines in Kyoto.
zh: 京都有很多神社。

en: Have you been to Kyoto?
zh: 你去过京都吗？

en: There are many old temples in Kyoto.
zh: 京都有很多古老的寺庙。

en: There are a lot of sights in Kyoto.
zh: 京都有很多观光景点。

en: Kyoto has many places to see.
zh: 京都值得一看的地方很多。

en: There are many places to see in Kyoto.
zh: 京都有很多值得一看的地方。

en: I have been to Kyoto once.
zh: 我去过一次京都。

en: There are many sights to see in Kyoto.
zh: 京都有很多值得一看的景点。

en: My brother in Kyoto became a teacher.
zh: 我在京都的哥哥当了老师。

en: Speaking of Kyoto, have you ever visited the Kinkakuji Temple?
zh: 说到京都，你去过金阁寺吗？

en: How about stopping over at Kyoto and sightseeing at the old capital?
zh: 顺道去京都，在古都观光怎么样？

en: In Kyoto, you can see both old and modern buildings.
zh: 在京都，你可以看到古老和现代的建筑。

en: From the airport, the Keisei Line Sky-Liner will take you to Ueno Station in 75 minutes.
zh: 从机场乘坐京成Skyliner线，75分钟即可到达上野站。

en: Kyoko is lying on the grass.
zh: 京子正躺在草地上。

en: Kyoko had the kindness to carry my baggage for me.
zh: 京子好心帮我拿行李。

en: I don't know exactly where Kyoko lives, but it's in the direction of Sannomiya.
zh: 我不太清楚京子住在哪里，但大概是三宫方向。

en: Please hide the blueberry jam where Takako can't see it.
zh: 请把蓝莓酱藏在多加子看不到的地方。

en: Fishing is one of the most popular hobbies.
zh: 钓鱼是最受欢迎的爱好之一。

en: Fishing just isn't my line.
zh: 钓鱼不适合我。

en: I prefer staying home to going fishing.
zh: 比起去钓鱼，我更喜欢待在家里。

en: My hobbies are fishing and watching television.
zh: 我的爱好是钓鱼和看电视。

en: How is it going in the fish market?

en: Eating fish is good for your health.
zh: 吃鱼对你的健康有好处。

en: Fish, please.

en: They sell fish and meat.
zh: 他们卖鱼和肉。

en: Fish are cold-blooded animals.

en: A fish swims by moving its tail.

en: Fish live in the water.

en: Fish cannot live out of water.
zh: 鱼离开水就不能活。

en: Do you like fish?

en: Fish live in the sea.
zh: 鱼生活在海里。

en: There are as good fish in the sea now as ever.
zh: 现在海里仍然有很多好鱼。

en: Do you think fish can hear?
zh: 你认为鱼能听见声音吗？

en: A fish can swim.
zh: 鱼会游泳。

en: Is the fish still alive?
zh: 这条鱼还活着吗？

en: I'll show you how to catch fish.
zh: 我来教你如何抓鱼。

en: I got a fish bone stuck in my throat.
zh: 我被鱼刺卡住了喉咙。

en: I nearly choked on a fishbone.
zh: 我差点被鱼刺噎住。

en: Air is to us what water is to fish.
zh: 空气之于我们，犹如水之于鱼。

en: How often do you feed the fish?

en: I seasoned the fish with salt and pepper.
zh: 我用盐和胡椒给鱼调味。

en: Fish and red wine don't go together.
zh: 鱼和红酒不搭。

en: Fish and meat are both nourishing, but the latter is more expensive than the former.
zh: 鱼和肉都有营养，但后者比前者更贵。

en: Fishing is not in my life.
zh: 钓鱼不在我的生活里。

en: Eat not only fish, but also meat.
zh: 不仅要吃鱼，也要吃肉。

en: I can no more swim than a fish can walk.
zh: 我不会游泳，就像鱼不会走路一样。

en: A fish leaped out of the water.
zh: 一条鱼跳出了水面。

en: We saw a fish splashing in the water.
zh: 我们看到一条鱼在水里扑腾。

en: The fish is burnt black.
zh: 这条鱼烧焦了。

en: Fish have ceased to live in this river.
zh: 这条河里已经没有鱼了。

en: I'd like some fish.
zh: 我想要一些鱼。

en: I'm allergic to fish.
zh: 我对鱼过敏。

en: A third party makes off with the profits.
zh: 第三方把利润卷走了。

en: I have no intention of fishing in troubled waters.
zh: 我无意浑水摸鱼。

en: Two dogs fight for a bone, and the third runs away with it.
zh: 两狗争骨，三狗得利。

en: The fisherman exaggerated the size of the fish he had caught.
zh: 渔夫夸大了他捕到的鱼的大小。

en: The fisherman cast his line into the water.
zh: 渔夫把鱼线抛入水中。

en: I can't judge distance.
zh: 我判断不了距离。

en: A fishing light wavers under the lee of an island.
zh: 岛屿背风处，渔火摇曳。

en: You can't enter the building without a permit.
zh: 没有许可证你不能进入大楼。

en: You can't enter here unless you have a pass.
zh: 没有通行证你不能进入这里。

en: Don't enter the room without leave.
zh: 未经允许，请勿进入房间。

en: Thank you for granting your permission.
zh: 感谢您给予许可。

en: Please refrain from speaking without permission.
zh: 请未经允许不要发言。

en: You mustn't enter this room without permission.
zh: 未经允许，你不得进入这个房间。

en: You shouldn't read people's private letters without permission.
zh: 你不应该未经允许阅读别人的私人信件。

en: You cannot take a picture in the theater without permission.
zh: 未经允许，你不能在剧院里拍照。

en: Please refrain from smoking without permission.
zh: 请未经允许不要吸烟。

en: We talked quite frankly.
zh: 我们坦诚地交谈了。

en: I'm going to speak to you with utmost candor so I want you to take everything I'm about to say at face value.
zh: 我将以最大的坦诚与你交谈，所以我希望你相信我接下来所说的一切。

en: In the end, he landed in jail.
zh: 最终，他进了监狱。

en: And on top of it all, I was fired.
zh: 而且最糟糕的是，我被解雇了。

en: A huge federal budget deficit has been plaguing the American economy for many years.
zh: 巨额联邦预算赤字多年来一直困扰着美国经济。

en: I was hit by a huge chunk of meat.
zh: 我被一大块肉击中了。

en: A gigantic bird came flying toward him.
zh: 一只巨大的鸟向他飞来。

en: A huge tanker put off just now.
zh: 一艘巨大的油轮刚刚启航。

en: I have two tickets to the Yomiuri Giants - Chunichi Dragons night game. Want to go?
zh: 我有两张读卖巨人队对中日龙队夜间比赛的票。想去吗？

en: It's so comfortable here, I really feel at home.
zh: 这里真舒服，我感觉就像在自己家一样。

en: An izakaya is a Japanese style pub.
zh: 居酒屋是日式酒吧。

en: We're doing the same old routine: going bar hopping and then to karaoke.
zh: 我们还是老一套：先去酒吧，然后去卡拉OK。

en: Those who were present were disappointed at the report.
zh: 出席的人对报告感到失望。

en: Those present were all moved to tears.
zh: 在场的人都感动得流下了眼泪。

en: Those present were surprised at the news.
zh: 在场的人对这个消息感到惊讶。

en: The living room adjoins the dining room.
zh: 客厅和餐厅相连。

en: When I was playing video games in the living room, Mother asked me if I would go shopping with her.
zh: 我在客厅玩电子游戏的时候，妈妈问我是否愿意和她一起去购物。

en: I had an operation for glaucoma last year.
zh: 我去年做了青光眼手术。

en: I had a miscarriage last year.
zh: 我去年流产了。

en: I had a stroke last year.
zh: 我去年中风了。

en: I had otitis media last year.
zh: 我去年得了中耳炎。

en: I delivered my first child last year.
zh: 我去年生了第一个孩子。

en: I put on a little weight last year.
zh: 我去年长胖了一点。

en: I lost my wife last year.
zh: 我去年失去了我的妻子。

en: I took an art class last year.
zh: 我去年上了一门艺术课。

en: Having failed last year, I don't like to try again.
zh: 因为去年失败了，我不想再尝试了。

en: Thanks to the amusement park built last year, the city has become popular.
zh: 多亏了去年建成的游乐园，这座城市变得受欢迎起来。

en: We could go out together like we did last year.
zh: 我们可以像去年一样一起出去玩。

en: Mr Brown took charge of this class last year.
zh: 布朗先生去年负责这个班级。

en: There was a sharp rise in prices last year.
zh: 去年物价大幅上涨。

en: The crops failed last year.
zh: 去年庄稼歉收了。

en: We had a lot of snow last year.
zh: 去年我们下了很多雪。

en: We had a lot of rain last year.
zh: 去年我们下了很多雨。

en: We had frequent snowfalls last year.
zh: 去年我们经常下雪。

en: I wore out two pairs of jogging shoes last year.
zh: 去年我穿坏了两双跑鞋。

en: We had a mild winter last year.
zh: 去年我们度过了一个暖冬。

en: We had a good deal of snow last winter.
zh: 去年冬天我们下了不少雪。

en: There was a lot of snow last winter.
zh: 去年冬天下了很多雪。

en: I took a cooking class last spring and learned to bake bread.
zh: 去年春天我上了一个烹饪课，学会了烤面包。

en: We moved to New York last fall.
zh: 去年秋天我们搬到了纽约。

en: I visited my father's hometown last summer.
zh: 去年夏天我去了我父亲的家乡。

en: She went there last summer.
zh: 去年夏天她去了那里。

en: Last summer, I worked part time on the farm.
zh: 去年夏天，我曾在农场做过兼职。

en: Last summer I traveled to Italy.
zh: 去年夏天我去了意大利旅行。

en: Last summer, I always took a walk in the morning.
zh: 去年夏天，我总是早上散步。

en: We had a good deal of rain last summer.
zh: 去年夏天我们下了很多雨。

en: I'll never forget visiting Paris last summer.
zh: 我永远不会忘记去年夏天去巴黎旅行。

en: The village which I visited last summer was a small one in Nagano Prefecture.
zh: 去年夏天我参观的那个村庄是长野县的一个小村庄。

en: It was not until last summer that my oldest son learned to swim.
zh: 直到去年夏天，我的大儿子才学会游泳。

en: As compared with last summer, we haven't had so much rain this year.
zh: 与去年夏天相比，今年我们没有下那么多雨。

en: Last year's pop hit was set off by a serial TV drama.
zh: 去年的流行歌曲是由一部连续剧引发的。

en: Compared with last year, this year's crops are much better.
zh: 与去年相比，今年的收成好多了。

en: I grew tomatoes last year and they were very good.
zh: 去年我种了西红柿，非常好吃。

en: He began to work for that company last year.
zh: 他去年开始在那家公司工作。

en: We had a kid just last year.
zh: 我们去年刚生了个孩子。

en: Hence, loathed melancholy.
zh: 因此，厌恶忧郁。

en: Out of sight out of mind. When you're separated you lose touch.
zh: 眼不见，心不烦。 分开后，你们就失去了联系。

en: My sister married a high school teacher last June.
zh: 我姐姐去年六月嫁给了一位高中老师。

en: The milkman came around at six every morning.
zh: 送牛奶的人每天早上六点左右来。

en: Is there a milkman?
zh: 有送牛奶的工人吗？

en: Add a little milk.
zh: 加一点牛奶。

en: Do you have some milk?
zh: 你有牛奶吗？

en: Won't you have another glass of milk?
zh: 不再来一杯牛奶吗？

en: We make milk into cheese and butter.
zh: 我们把牛奶做成奶酪和黄油。

en: I bought two bottles of milk.
zh: 我买了两个瓶子的牛奶。

en: I want a quart of milk.
zh: 我想要一夸脱牛奶。

en: The milk froze and became solid.
zh: 牛奶结冰变硬了。

en: Milk is a popular beverage.
zh: 牛奶是一种受欢迎的饮料。

en: Milk boils at a higher temperature than water.
zh: 牛奶的沸点比水高。

en: Milk does not agree with me.
zh: 我喝牛奶不舒服。

en: Milk makes us strong.
zh: 牛奶使我们强壮。

en: Milk easily turns sour.
zh: 牛奶容易变酸。

en: Milk is made into butter and cheese.
zh: 牛奶被制成黄油和奶酪。

en: There's only a little milk left.
zh: 只剩下一点牛奶了。

en: Milk is made into butter.
zh: 牛奶被制成黄油。

en: Milk can be made into butter, cheese, and many other things.
zh: 牛奶可以制成黄油、奶酪和许多其他东西。

en: Milk will do you good. You'd better drink it every day.
zh: 喝牛奶对你有好处。你最好每天都喝。

en: The milk turned sour.
zh: 牛奶变酸了。

en: Will you drink wine instead of milk?
zh: 你喝葡萄酒代替牛奶吗？

en: The milk was adulterated with water.
zh: 牛奶里掺了水。

en: Blend milk and eggs together.
zh: 把牛奶和鸡蛋混合在一起。

en: The milk has gone bad.
zh: 牛奶变质了。

en: The milk has turned sour.
zh: 牛奶变酸了。

en: You must buy milk, eggs, butter, and so on.
zh: 你必须买牛奶、鸡蛋、黄油等等。

en: It will be four years before the definite result of beef liberalization emerges.
zh: 牛肉自由化明确结果的出现还需要四年时间。

en: Beef, please.
zh: 请给我牛肉。

en: Have you got any preference between beef and lamb?
zh: 牛肉和羊肉，你有什么偏好吗？

en: You cannot sell the cow and drink the milk.
zh: 你不能卖掉奶牛又喝牛奶（比喻杀鸡取卵）。

en: I raise cattle.
zh: 我养牛。

en: And he chased the cattle, the sheep, and the people out of the temple.
zh: 他把牛、羊和人都赶出了圣殿。

en: A cow is a useful animal.
zh: 牛是有用的动物。

en: The cows were moving very slowly through the long green grass.
zh: 奶牛们在长长的绿草中缓慢地移动。

en: The cows looked big and docile.
zh: 奶牛看起来又大又温顺。

en: Cows live on grass.
zh: 奶牛以草为生。

en: Cattle feed on grass.
zh: 牛以草为食。

en: Cows supply us with many things we need.
zh: 奶牛为我们提供许多我们需要的东西。

en: Cows give us milk.
zh: 奶牛给我们牛奶。

en: Cows provide us with milk.
zh: 奶牛为我们提供牛奶。

en: Cows provide us with good milk.
zh: 奶牛为我们提供优质的牛奶。

en: The cow is anything but bright.
zh: 牛一点也不聪明。

en: Cows are anything but bright.
zh: 牛一点也不聪明。

en: The cow missed being hit by a gnat's whisker.
zh: 这头牛差一点就被蚊子的触须击中。

en: An ox is captured by the horns, a person is bound by his word.
zh: 牛以角被擒，人以言被缚。

en: The cow supplies us with milk.
zh: 奶牛为我们提供牛奶。

en: Cows supply us with milk.
zh: 奶牛为我们提供牛奶。

en: Cows give us milk, and hens eggs.
zh: 奶牛给我们牛奶，母鸡给我们鸡蛋。

en: A cow gives us milk.
zh: 一头奶牛给我们牛奶。

en: Cows are sacred to Hindus.
zh: 牛在印度教徒眼中是神圣的。

en: Cows are more useful than any other animal in this country.
zh: 在这个国家，牛比任何其他动物都更有用。

en: Yoke the oxen to the plow.
zh: 把牛套在犁上。

en: Cattle were grazing in the field.
zh: 牛在田里吃草。

en: Cows are eating grass in the meadow.
zh: 奶牛在草地上吃草。

en: The cows are eating grass.
zh: 奶牛在吃草。

en: I ran into an old friend.
zh: 我碰到了一个老朋友。

en: Meeting my old friend was very pleasant.
zh: 遇到我的老朋友非常愉快。

en: Old friends called on me.
zh: 老朋友来看我了。

en: My old friend dropped in at my house.
zh: 我的老朋友顺便来我家拜访。

en: My old friend wrote to me, informing me of his return from abroad.
zh: 我的老朋友写信告诉我他从国外回来了。

en: Old friends were invited to the reception.
zh: 老朋友被邀请参加招待会。

en: I've used up my wages, but I have my bank account to fall back on.
zh: 我的工资用完了，但我还有银行存款可以依靠。

en: As soon as I get paid I will pay you back.
zh: 我一拿到工资就会还你。

en: I received a five hundred dollar advance on my pay.
zh: 我收到了五百美元的预支工资。

en: Wages vary in relation to the age of the worker.
zh: 工资因工人的年龄而异。

en: The salary is fixed according to age and experience.
zh: 工资是根据年龄和经验确定的。

en: The wages will be paid in proportion to the work done.
zh: 工资将按完成的工作量支付。

en: You will be paid according to your ability.
zh: 你的工资将根据你的能力支付。

en: Pay will be based on experience and educational background.
zh: 工资将根据经验和教育背景而定。

en: Can I get an advance on my salary?
zh: 我可以预支工资吗？

en: In terms of salary, that job is fantastic.
zh: 就工资而言，那份工作太棒了。

en: Aside from his salary, he receives money from investments.
zh: 除了工资，他还从投资中获得收入。

en: It's a good job, as far as the pay goes.
zh: 就工资而言，这是一份好工作。

en: He is not better off because he is poorly paid.
zh: 他过得并不好，因为他的工资很低。

en: His low salary prevents him from buying the house.
zh: 他微薄的工资使他无法买房。

en: You should not despise a man because he is poorly paid.
zh: 你不应该因为一个人工资低而鄙视他。

en: Since I got a raise, I can manage.
zh: 自从我涨工资后，我能应付了。

en: This is a better way of paying people, according to Paula Grayson.
zh: 根据保拉·格雷森的说法，这是一种更好的支付工资的方式。

en: The income tax rate increases in proportion as your salary rises.
zh: 所得税税率随着你的工资上涨而增加。

en: Do you have a school lunch at school?
zh: 你在学校吃学校午餐吗？

en: The printer needs paper.
zh: 打印机需要纸。

en: The waiter brought a new plate.
zh: 服务员端来了一个新盘子。

en: Waiter, please bring me some water.
zh: 服务员，请给我拿些水。

en: On behalf of my classmates, let me say a few words of thanks to you.
zh: 我谨代表我的同学们，向您致以几句感谢的话。

en: The classmates felt for him deeply.
zh: 同学们深深地同情他。

en: His classmates' jeers reduced him to tears.
zh: 他同学们的嘲笑让他泪流满面。

en: Some of the classmates passed the examination, but the others didn't.
zh: 一些同学通过了考试，但其他的没有。

en: He will wriggle out of the fix.
zh: 他会摆脱困境的。

en: A cornered rat will bite a cat.
zh: 狗急跳墙。

en: Necessity is the mother of invention.
zh: 需要是发明之母。

en: Ultimately, space flight will be beneficial to all mankind.
zh: 最终，太空飞行将有益于全人类。

en: The stadium was quite still.
zh: 体育场非常安静。

en: There were a lot of people in the stadium.
zh: 体育场里有很多人。

en: The ball rolled into the stream.
zh: 球滚进了小溪里。

en: The ball slightly curved.
zh: 球稍微弯曲了一下。

en: The ball bounced over the wall.
zh: 球弹过了墙。

en: One third of the earth's surface is desert.
zh: 地球表面的三分之一是沙漠。

en: Crying is an expression of grief.
zh: 哭泣是悲伤的表达。

en: It's not worth crying over.
zh: 不值得为它哭泣。

en: To weep is to make less the depth of grief.
zh: 哭泣可以减轻悲伤的深度。

en: Misfortunes never come singly.
zh: 祸不单行。

en: I can't let the matter drop.
zh: 我不能就此罢休。

en: We just have to swallow it.
zh: 我们只能忍气吞声。

en: I quickly laugh at everything, for fear of having to cry.
zh: 我很快就拿一切开玩笑，因为害怕哭泣。

en: I feel like crying.
zh: 我想哭。

en: Try to keep from crying.
zh: 尽量别哭。

en: I could've cried.
zh: 我本来会哭的。

en: I can't help crying.
zh: 我忍不住哭。

en: I don't know whether to cry or to laugh.
zh: 我不知道是该哭还是该笑。

en: Crying is of no avail.
zh: 哭是没有用的。

en: There is only one day left, whether we like it or not.
zh: 不管我们喜不喜欢，只剩最后一天了。

en: It's hard to handle crying babies.
zh: 哭闹的婴儿很难哄。

en: And, many times, I've cried.
zh: 而且，很多时候，我都哭过。

en: Don't shout at the crying child. It only adds fuel to the fire.
zh: 不要对哭闹的孩子大喊大叫。这只会火上浇油。

en: The young man who has not wept is a savage, and the old man who will not laugh is a fool.
zh: 没有哭过的年轻人是野蛮人，不会笑的老人是傻瓜。

en: The job advertisement specifically requested females.
zh: 招聘广告特别要求女性。

en: Ask, and it shall be given you.
zh: 祈求，就给你们。

en: There is nothing that does not decay.
zh: 没有不腐烂的东西。

en: The lifeguard is ever ready to help others.
zh: 救生员随时准备帮助他人。

en: The rescue workers are going to hand out supplies to the victims of the earthquake.
zh: 救援人员将向地震灾民分发物资。

en: Try to hold on until a rescue team arrives.
zh: 尽量坚持到救援队到来。

en: The rescued refugees were longing for freedom.
zh: 获救的难民渴望自由。

en: We waited for hours before help arrived.
zh: 我们等了几个小时才等到救援。

en: She did not eat anything until she was rescued.
zh: 她获救之前什么都没吃。

en: Where should I go to be admitted into the emergency room?
zh: 我应该去哪里才能进入急诊室？

en: Call an ambulance.
zh: 叫救护车。

en: The ambulances carried the injured to the nearest hospital.
zh: 救护车将伤员送往最近的医院。

en: Do you need an ambulance?
zh: 你需要救护车吗？

en: The ambulance broke down in the middle of the busy avenue.
zh: 救护车在繁忙的大道中央抛锚了。

en: The rescue worker beat the area, looking for the child.
zh: 救援人员在那个区域搜寻，寻找那个孩子。

en: He was still alive when the rescue party arrived.
zh: 救援队到达时，他仍然活着。

en: The rescue flight had to reckon with strong winds and freezing temperatures.
zh: 救援飞行不得不应对强风和冰冻的温度。

en: Urgent business prevented him from going.
zh: 紧急事务阻止了他前往。

en: Urgent business kept me from going shopping with you.
zh: 紧急事务使我无法和你一起去购物。

en: Urgent business kept me from coming soon.
zh: 紧急事务使我无法很快前来。

en: Urgent business prevented him from coming.
zh: 紧急事务阻止了他前来。

en: Urgent business has called him away.
zh: 紧急事务把他叫走了。

en: Urgent business kept him from going to the concert.
zh: 紧急事务使他无法去听音乐会。

en: A sudden illness prevented him from going there.
zh: 突发疾病阻止了他去那里。

en: A sudden illness forced her to cancel her appointment.
zh: 突发疾病迫使她取消了预约。

en: A sudden illness prevented me from going to the station to meet him.
zh: 突发疾病使我无法去车站接他。

en: The express train does not stop between Shibuya and Naka-Meguro.
zh: 特快列车在涩谷和中目黑之间不停靠。

en: The express train is an hour faster than the local.
zh: 特快列车比普通列车快一个小时。

en: Are there any express trains?
zh: 有特快列车吗？

en: The express train went by so fast that we hardly saw it.
zh: 特快列车飞驰而过，我们几乎没看清。

en: The express arrives at 6:30 p.m.
zh: 特快列车下午六点半到达。

en: The express starts at six and gets into Tokyo at nine.
zh: 特快列车六点出发，九点到达东京。

en: How much is the express?
zh: 特快列车多少钱？

en: To take an express train, we have to get an express ticket in addition to an ordinary ticket.
zh: 要乘坐特快列车，除了普通车票外，我们还必须购买特快车票。

en: I need medical help.
zh: 我需要医疗帮助。

en: Please hurry, it's urgent.
zh: 请快点，情况紧急。

en: I burst into tears.
zh: 我突然放声大哭。

en: I suddenly stood up and felt faint and light-headed.
zh: 我突然站起来，感到头晕眼花。

en: I'm sorry we gave you such short notice of our visit.
zh: 很抱歉我们这么晚才通知你们来访。

en: There was a sudden change in her tone.
zh: 她的语气突然变了。

en: Suddenly, he changed the subject.
zh: 他突然转移了话题。

en: I've suddenly started to gain weight.
zh: 我突然开始体重增加。

en: Don't burst out laughing like that. It's creepy.
zh: 别那样突然大笑，怪吓人的。

en: Don't take that dramatic attitude all of a sudden.
zh: 别突然摆出那副戏剧性的姿态。

en: All of a sudden the sky became overcast.
zh: 突然间，天空变得阴沉起来。

en: Suddenly the heavens opened.
zh: 突然下起了倾盆大雨。

en: Suddenly I got lucky.
zh: 我突然走运了。

en: Suddenly rain began to fall.
zh: 突然开始下雨了。

en: All of a sudden, large drops of rain began falling from the dark sky.
zh: 突然间，大滴的雨点从阴暗的天空落下来。

en: I've suddenly lost weight.
zh: 我突然瘦了。

en: Don't brake suddenly.
zh: 不要突然刹车。

en: Suddenly Jim pulled the car up in front of the bank.
zh: 吉姆突然把车停在了银行前面。

en: The storm broke.
zh: 暴风雨来了。

en: All of a sudden, three dogs appeared in front of us.
zh: 突然，三只狗出现在我们面前。

en: If you hurry, you'll catch up with him.
zh: 如果你快点，你就能赶上他。

en: If we hurry, we'll make it.
zh: 如果我们快点，我们就能赶上。

en: Hurry, and you will catch the train.
zh: 快点，你就能赶上火车。

en: If you hurry up, you will be in time.
zh: 如果你快点，你就能及时赶到。

en: I think we'll make it if we hurry.
zh: 我想如果我们快点，我们就能赶上。

en: Hurry up, and you'll catch the bus.
zh: 快点，你就能赶上公共汽车。

en: If you hurry, you can make the next bus.
zh: 如果你快点，你能赶上下一班公共汽车。

en: Hurry up, and you'll be in time for school.
zh: 快点，这样你就能赶上上学了。

en: Hurry, help.
zh: 快，救命啊。

en: Hurry up. You'll be late for school.
zh: 快点，你上学要迟到了。

en: Hurry up, or you will miss the train.
zh: 快点，不然你会错过火车的。

en: Come on! We're going to be late.
zh: 快点！我们要迟到了。

en: Hurry up, or you will miss the last train.
zh: 快点，不然你会错过末班车的。

en: Hurry up, or you will be late for the last train.
zh: 快点，不然你赶不上末班车了。

en: There seems no need to hurry.
zh: 似乎没有必要着急。

en: We needn't have hurried.
zh: 我们本不必那么着急的。

en: You don't have to hurry.
zh: 你不必着急。

en: There is no hurry; you have five days to think the matter over.
zh: 不用着急，你有五天的时间来考虑这件事。

en: There's no hurry.
zh: 不用着急。

en: We didn't need to hurry.
zh: 我们没必要那么着急。

en: Let's hurry up.
zh: 我们快点吧。

en: Hurry up, or you'll be late for school.
zh: 快点，不然你上学要迟到了。

en: Hurry up, and you can catch the train.
zh: 快点，你就能赶上火车了。

en: Hurry up, or you will be late.
zh: 快点，不然你要迟到了。

en: You will miss the train if you don't hurry.
zh: 如果你不快点，你就会错过火车的。

en: Hurry up, or you won't catch up with him.
zh: 快点，不然你就赶不上他了。

en: Hurry up! The concert is starting.
zh: 快点！音乐会要开始了。

en: Hurry up, or you'll miss the bus.
zh: 快点，不然你会错过公共汽车的。

en: Hurry up, or you will be late for school.
zh: 快点，不然你上学要迟到了。

en: Hurry up, or we'll miss the train.
zh: 快点，不然我们会错过火车的。

en: Hurry up, and you will be on time.
zh: 快点，你就能及时赶到。

en: Hurry up, or you'll miss your plane.
zh: 快点，不然你会错过飞机的。

en: Hurry up, and you will be able to catch the train.
zh: 快点，你就能赶上火车了。

en: Hurry up, and you'll catch the train.
zh: 快点，你就能赶上火车了。

en: Make haste, and you will be in time.
zh: 快点，你就能及时赶到。

en: Hurry up, and you will be in time for school.
zh: 快点，你就能及时赶到学校。

en: Hurry up, and you will be in time for the bus.
zh: 快点，你就能及时赶上公交车。

en: Hurry up, and you can catch the bus.
zh: 快点，你就能赶上公交车。

en: Hurry up, or you'll miss the train.
zh: 快点，不然你会错过火车的。

en: Make haste, or you will be late.
zh: 快点，不然你会迟到的。

en: Hurry up, or you'll be late.
zh: 快点，不然你会迟到的。

en: Hurry up, or you will miss the bus.
zh: 快点，不然你会错过公交车的。

en: More haste, less speed.
zh: 欲速则不达。

en: Be quick, or you will miss the train.
zh: 快点，不然你会错过火车的。

en: You must hurry up, or you will miss the express.
zh: 你必须快点，不然你会错过快车的。

en: Unless you hurry, you will be late for school.
zh: 除非你快点，否则你上学要迟到了。

en: You can take your time.
zh: 你可以慢慢来。

en: We've got to hurry. Mr Itoh will call the roll.
zh: 我们得快点。伊藤先生要点名了。

en: Hurry, or you'll miss the train.
zh: 快点，不然你会错过火车的。

en: Hurry up, otherwise you'll be late for lunch.
zh: 快点，不然你午饭就要迟到了。

en: Hurry or we'll never make the train!
zh: 快点，不然我们永远赶不上火车了！

en: Hurry up, or it will start raining.
zh: 快点，不然就要下雨了。

en: You'll miss the train if you don't hurry.
zh: 如果你不快点，你就会错过火车的。

en: If you don't hurry, you'll miss the train.
zh: 如果你不快点，你就会错过火车的。

en: Don't dash off a sloppily written report filled with mistakes.
zh: 不要匆匆忙忙地写一份充满错误的报告。

en: You make mistakes if you do things in a hurry.
zh: 如果你匆忙行事，你就会犯错。

en: Please hurry and finish the prospectus.
zh: 请快点完成招股说明书。

en: Hurry up and set the table for dinner.
zh: 快点把餐桌摆好，准备吃饭了。

en: There's enough time for a quick snack.
zh: 还有时间吃点零食。

en: Having been written in haste, his letter was hard to read.
zh: 因为是匆忙写成的，他的信很难读。

en: Having been written in haste, the book has a lot of errors.
zh: 因为是匆忙写成的，这本书有很多错误。

en: As it was written in haste, the book has many faults.
zh: 因为写得很仓促，这本书有很多缺点。

en: Having been written in a hurry, this letter has many mistakes in it.
zh: 因为是匆忙写成的，这封信有很多错误。

en: As it had been written in haste, the report was poor.
zh: 因为是匆忙写成的，这份报告很糟糕。

en: I must hurry to class.
zh: 我得赶紧去上课了。

en: Let's finish up in a hurry.
zh: 我们赶紧结束吧。

en: It is better to take your time than to hurry and make mistakes.
zh: 慢慢来比匆忙出错要好。

en: Hurry along or you'll be late.
zh: 快点走，不然你要迟到了。

en: There is no need to draw a hasty conclusion.
zh: 没有必要匆忙下结论。

en: I hurried home.
zh: 我匆匆忙忙地赶回家。

en: It's better to take your time than to hurry and make mistakes.
zh: 慢慢来比匆忙出错要好。

en: I rushed out of my house.
zh: 我冲出了家门。

en: I hurried and managed to catch the bus.
zh: 我赶紧跑，总算赶上了公共汽车。

en: Let's catch a quick bite.
zh: 我们赶紧吃点东西吧。

en: Let's get something quick to drink.
zh: 我们赶紧喝点什么吧。

en: I hurried to the station only to find that the train had already left.
zh: 我匆忙赶到车站，结果发现火车已经开走了。

en: As it was printed in haste, the book has many misprints.
zh: 因为是匆忙印刷的，这本书有很多印刷错误。

en: I avoid crossing the street here if I am in a hurry.
zh: 如果我赶时间，我就避免在这里过马路。

en: Be more careful. Rushing through things is going to ruin your work.
zh: 更仔细一点。匆匆忙忙地做事会毁了你的工作。

en: Haste makes waste.
zh: 欲速则不达。

en: If you run fast, you can catch the train.
zh: 如果你跑得快，你就能赶上火车。

en: Hurry up, Tom.
zh: 快点，汤姆。

en: I have an urgent matter to attend to.
zh: 我有个急事要处理。

en: Please hurry.
zh: 请快点。

en: Our bus comes late particularly when we are in a hurry.
zh: 我们赶时间的时候，公交车总是晚点。

en: We've really got to step on it.
zh: 我们真的得抓紧时间了。

en: Are you in a hurry?
zh: 你赶时间吗？

en: That sort of thing can happen when you are in haste.
zh: 那种事情在你匆忙的时候可能会发生。

en: When you're in a hurry, it's easy to make a mistake.
zh: 当你匆忙的时候，很容易犯错。

en: People who are not in a hurry stand on the right side of the escalator.
zh: 不着急的人站在自动扶梯的右侧。

en: We'd better make some time.
zh: 我们最好挤出点时间。

en: Hurry up. The train leaves in ten minutes. We don't want to miss it.
zh: 快点。火车十分钟后就要开了。我们不想错过它。

en: Hurry up. We've little time to waste.
zh: 快点。我们没多少时间可以浪费了。

en: Hurry up, or we'll be late.
zh: 快点，不然我们要迟到了。

en: Hurry up! Here comes the bus.
zh: 快点！公交车来了。

en: You had better hurry. The train leaves at three.
zh: 你最好快点。火车三点开。

en: Even though she rushed, the elderly woman missed the last train.
zh: 即使她很着急，那位老妇人还是错过了末班车。

en: All my haste was in vain.
zh: 我所有的匆忙都是徒劳的。

en: In my hurry I bumped into someone.
zh: 我匆忙中撞到了人。

en: In the palace live the king and the queen.
zh: 国王和王后住在宫殿里。

en: The palace has a tall tower.
zh: 这座宫殿有一座高塔。

en: Miyazaki is not what it used to be.
zh: 宫崎骏已经不是以前的样子了。

en: Blotting paper absorbs ink.
zh: 吸墨纸吸收墨水。

en: Legends of vampires flourish in the Balkans.
zh: 吸血鬼的传说在巴尔干半岛盛行。

en: I will help you all I can.
zh: 我会尽我所能帮助你。

en: Instead of taking a rest, he worked much harder than usual.
zh: 他没有休息，反而比平时更努力地工作。

en: You just need a good rest.
zh: 你只需要好好休息一下。

en: We are looking forward to the holidays.
zh: 我们期待着假期。

en: Enjoy your holidays.
zh: 祝你假期愉快。

en: It will do you good to have a holiday.
zh: 休假对你有好处。

en: Did you enjoy your holiday?
zh: 你假期过得愉快吗？

en: She agreed with him about the holiday plan.
zh: 她同意他关于度假计划的看法。

en: I'm just sorting out some suitable clothes to take on holiday.
zh: 我正在整理一些适合度假穿的衣服。

en: I'd like to spend my holidays reading history books or classics.
zh: 我想用假期来读历史书或经典著作。

en: The holiday traffic crawled along the highway.
zh: 假日交通在高速公路上缓慢行驶。

en: If we would rest a little we would feel surely very much refreshed.
zh: 如果我们稍微休息一下，肯定会感觉精神焕发。

en: Take a rest.
zh: 休息一下。

en: The closing of school was due to the heavy snow.
zh: 学校停课是由于大雪。

en: He stayed there during the vacation.
zh: 他在那里度过了假期。

en: During the interval, Takashi and Harumi got a drink at the theater bar.
zh: 幕间休息时，隆和春美在剧院酒吧喝了一杯。

en: If you work too long without a rest, it begins to tell on you.
zh: 如果你工作时间太长而不休息，它就会开始影响你。

en: You have only a short rest, so make the best of it.
zh: 你只有短暂的休息时间，所以要好好利用。

en: Pretty soon we'd better wrap up this break and get back to work.
zh: 我们最好尽快结束休息，回去工作。

en: When is the intermission?
zh: 什么时候是中场休息时间？

en: Let's have some coffee during recess.
zh: 课间休息时我们喝点咖啡吧。

en: Shall we take a rest?
zh: 我们休息一下好吗？

en: Let's take a break for coffee.
zh: 我们休息一下喝杯咖啡吧。

en: I move that the meeting adjourn.
zh: 我提议休会。

en: What did you do on your vacation?
zh: 你假期做了什么？

en: I spent idle days during the vacation.
zh: 假期里我无所事事。

en: In the vacation, I read the entire works of Milton.
zh: 假期里，我读了弥尔顿的全部作品。

en: During the vacation my sister and I stayed at a small village at the foot of Mt. Fuji.
zh: 假期里，我和姐姐住在富士山脚下的一个小村庄。

en: While we were on holiday, a neighbor took care of our cat.
zh: 我们度假的时候，邻居帮我们照顾了猫。

en: Let's take advantage of the vacation to mow the lawn.
zh: 咱们趁着放假把草坪修剪一下吧。

en: The number of students who travel abroad for vacation is increasing.
zh: 出国度假的学生人数正在增加。

en: Let's take advantage of the vacation to go on a hike.
zh: 咱们趁着放假去徒步旅行吧。

en: Please cut short your vacation and return.
zh: 请缩短假期并返回。

en: If you don't take a vacation, you'll collapse.
zh: 如果你不休假，你会垮掉的。

en: Enjoy your vacation.
zh: 祝你假期愉快。

en: It's costing me a lot to spend the holidays.
zh: 过节花了我很多钱。

en: We argued with each other about the best place for a holiday.
zh: 我们为了去哪里度假争论不休。

en: How did you spend your vacation?
zh: 你假期是怎么过的？

en: Where do you suppose you'll spend your vacation?
zh: 你打算去哪里度假？

en: Can you extend your holiday by a few days?
zh: 你能把假期延长几天吗？

en: Make the most of your vacation.
zh: 好好享受你的假期。

en: The vacation is close to an end.
zh: 假期快要结束了。

en: The holidays came to an end at last.
zh: 假期终于结束了。

en: We have five days to go before the holidays.
zh: 离放假还有五天。

en: The holidays seem to be doing her health good.
zh: 假期似乎对她的健康有益。

en: We must make the most of our vacation, as it is so short.
zh: 我们必须充分利用我们的假期，因为它太短了。

en: I'll be only too pleased to help you.
zh: 我很乐意帮助你。

en: Where are you going on vacation?
zh: 你打算去哪里度假？

en: How was your vacation?
zh: 你的假期怎么样？

en: The holidays always end all too soon.
zh: 假期总是结束得太快。

en: How did you enjoy your vacation?
zh: 你假期过得怎么样？

en: The holidays ended all too soon.
zh: 假期结束得太快了。

en: The holiday ended all too soon.
zh: 假期结束得太快了。

en: My vacation went by quickly.
zh: 我的假期过得真快。

en: The vacation came to an end all too soon.
zh: 假期结束得太快了。

en: My wife and I agreed on a holiday plan.
zh: 我和我妻子就度假计划达成了一致。

en: Tell me what you did on your holidays.
zh: 告诉我你假期做了什么。

en: Have you made up your mind where to go for the holidays?
zh: 你决定好去哪里度假了吗？

en: Would you look after my children while I am away on vacation?
zh: 我度假的时候，你能帮我照顾一下孩子吗？

en: When I go on vacation, I'll rent a car.
zh: 我度假的时候，会租一辆车。

en: Do you sometimes go abroad on your holidays?
zh: 你有时会出国度假吗？

en: She was very brown after her holiday.
zh: 她度假回来后，皮肤晒得很黑。

en: When the vacation is over, I will catch up with a lot of work.
zh: 假期结束后，我要补上很多工作。

en: When I return from vacation, I shall have to catch up with a lot of work.
zh: 我度假回来后，要补上很多工作。

en: May I take a rest?
zh: 我可以休息一下吗？

en: Who is absent?
zh: 谁缺席了？

en: Stand at ease!
zh: 稍息！

en: Will this cover the holiday expenses?
zh: 这能负担度假的费用吗？

en: Where are you going to go on your vacation?
zh: 你打算去哪里度假？

en: He is lively during recess.
zh: 课间休息时他很活跃。

en: Taking a little time off?
zh: 休息一下吗？

en: I did nothing during the holidays.
zh: 假期我什么也没做。

en: There are many tourists in the city on holidays.
zh: 假期期间，城市里有很多游客。

en: What do you usually do on holidays?
zh: 你通常在假期做什么？

en: In her leisure time, she enjoys swimming and tennis.
zh: 她空闲时喜欢游泳和打网球。

en: Please come and see us sometime during the vacation.
zh: 假期的时候，请来我们这里看看。

en: Do you feel like resting?
zh: 你想休息一下吗？

en: Too much rest is rust.
zh: 休息过多会生锈。

en: Too long a holiday makes one reluctant to start work again.
zh: 假期太长会让人不想重新开始工作。

en: The holiday continues to be very boring.
zh: 这个假期仍然非常无聊。

en: I'm dying to see Kumiko.
zh: 我非常想见到久美子。

en: Kumi did not talk about her club.
zh: 久美没有谈论她的社团。

en: Hearing this song after so long really brings back the old times.
zh: 这么久之后听到这首歌，真的让人回忆起过去的美好时光。

en: After a long absence he came back.
zh: 他离开很久之后回来了。

en: An old friend of mine dropped in on me for the first time in ages.
zh: 一位老朋友很久之后第一次来拜访我。

en: It's been so long since we've met, let's have a drink or two and talk about the good old days.
zh: 我们很久没见了，喝一两杯，聊聊过去的美好时光吧。

en: I haven't seen him for a long time.
zh: 我很久没见到他了。

en: Please forgive me for not having written for a long time.
zh: 请原谅我很久没有写信了。

en: Will Mr Oka teach English?
zh: 冈先生会教英语吗？

en: After running up the hill, I was completely out of breath.
zh: 跑上山后，我完全喘不过气来。

en: The hills are bathed in sunlight.
zh: 山丘沐浴在阳光下。

en: The hill lay covered with snow.
zh: 山丘覆盖着积雪。

en: The hill slopes downward to the river.
zh: 山丘向下倾斜到河流。

en: The hill was all covered with snow.
zh: 山丘上覆盖着积雪。

en: The hill glows with autumnal colors.
zh: 山丘闪耀着秋天的色彩。

en: The hill is always green.
zh: 山丘总是绿色的。

en: You see a white building at the foot of the hill.
zh: 你在山脚下看到一座白色的建筑物。

en: The wind blew harder yet when we reached the top of the hill.
zh: 当我们到达山顶时，风刮得更大了。

en: The building which stands on the hillside is our school.
zh: 坐落在山坡上的那栋建筑是我们的学校。

en: A castle stands a little way up the hill.
zh: 一座城堡矗立在山坡上不远处。

en: Our school on the hill commands a full view of Mt. Fuji.
zh: 我们山上的学校可以俯瞰富士山的景色。

en: The building on the hill is our school.
zh: 山上的那栋建筑是我们的学校。

en: The old church on the hill dates back to the twelfth century.
zh: 山上的那座古老的教堂可以追溯到十二世纪。

en: That church on the hill is very old.
zh: 山上的那座教堂很古老。

en: Situated on a hill, his house commands a fine view.
zh: 他的房子坐落在山上，视野极佳。

en: Standing as it does on a hill, the hotel commands a fine view of the bay.
zh: 酒店坐落在山上，可以俯瞰海湾的美景。

en: Look at that tower standing on the hill.
zh: 看看山上矗立的那座塔。

en: Look at that building standing on the hill.
zh: 看看山上矗立的那栋建筑。

en: There stands a beautiful church on the hill.
zh: 山上矗立着一座美丽的教堂。

en: The house which stands on the hill is very old.
zh: 山上的那栋房子很古老。

en: Are there oak trees on the hill?
zh: 山上有没有橡树？

en: There is a large house on the hill.
zh: 山上有一栋大房子。

en: There is a house on the hill.
zh: 山上有一栋房子。

en: His house was in sight from the top of the hill.
zh: 从山顶可以看到他的房子。

en: From the hill, we could see all the buildings in the city.
zh: 从山上，我们可以看到城市里的所有建筑物。

en: Lots of campers were parked all over the hill-side.
zh: 许多露营者把车停在山坡上。

en: A beautiful valley lies behind the hill.
zh: 山后有一个美丽的山谷。

en: We came in sight of the hill.
zh: 我们看到了那座山。

en: At the foot of the hill is a beautiful lake.
zh: 山脚下是一个美丽的湖泊。

en: Lots of low trees grow on the hill.
zh: 山上长着许多矮树。

en: We can get a beautiful view of the sea from the hill.
zh: 从山上我们可以看到美丽的海景。

en: My neck snapped when I did a headstand.
zh: 我倒立的时候脖子扭断了。

en: Paradoxically, he is right.
zh: 矛盾的是，他是对的。

en: She carries on smiling even in the face of adversity.
zh: 即使面对逆境，她仍然保持微笑。

en: Despite adversity, the ingenious man achieved worldwide fame.
zh: 尽管身处逆境，这位才华横溢的人还是获得了世界性的声誉。

en: Despite adversity, the architect achieved worldwide fame.
zh: 尽管身处逆境，这位建筑师还是获得了世界性的声誉。

en: Adversity is the best school.
zh: 逆境是最好的学校。

en: The converse is also true.
zh: 反之亦然。

en: Please turn over.
zh: 请翻身。

en: The footnotes are at the bottom of the page.
zh: 脚注在页面的底部。

en: Footnotes are notes at the foot of a page.
zh: 脚注是位于页面底部的注释。

en: Throw away the chairs whose legs are broken.
zh: 把那些腿坏了的椅子扔掉。

en: I'll be about again when my leg heals.
zh: 等我的腿好了，我就又能到处走了。

en: The guests wished the happy couple a long and prosperous life.
zh: 客人们祝这对幸福的夫妇生活幸福美满。

en: A flight attendant walks up to the boys.
zh: 一位空乘人员走向那些男孩。

en: From an objective viewpoint, his argument was far from rational.
zh: 从客观的角度来看，他的论点远非理性。

en: The visitor sat across from me.
zh: 来访者坐在我的对面。

en: Guests arrived by twos and threes.
zh: 客人们三三两两地到达。

en: The guests are all gone.
zh: 客人都走了。

en: The customer did not come.
zh: 顾客没有来。

en: Customers stopped coming to our shop.
zh: 顾客不再光顾我们的商店了。

en: The number of guests is 20.
zh: 客人的数量是20。

en: You should prepare a room for the visitor.
zh: 你应该为来访者准备一个房间。

en: I saw some of the guests leave the banquet room.
zh: 我看到一些客人离开了宴会厅。

en: She was pleased to be treated as a guest.
zh: 她很高兴被当作客人对待。

en: The visitors were greeted with warm handshakes.
zh: 来访者受到了热烈的握手欢迎。

en: When the visitor entered the room, we stood to greet him.
zh: 当来访者进入房间时，我们站起来迎接他。

en: I've lost my filling.
zh: 我的补牙掉了。

en: This tooth has to have a filling.
zh: 这颗牙需要补一下。

en: As I entered the café, I found two young men watching a wrestling match on television.
zh: 当我走进咖啡馆时，我发现两个年轻人正在看电视上的摔跤比赛。

en: As I entered a tearoom, I found two young men watching a wrestling match on television.
zh: 当我走进一家茶馆时，我发现两个年轻人正在看电视上的摔跤比赛。

en: I asked for a seat in the smoking section.
zh: 我要求坐在吸烟区。

en: Smoking, please.
zh: 吸烟区。

en: Smoking or non-smoking?
zh: 吸烟区还是非吸烟区？

en: Is there a place I can smoke?
zh: 请问哪里可以吸烟？

en: Could we have a table in the smoking section?
zh: 我们可以在吸烟区要一张桌子吗？

en: Smokers are far more likely to develop lung cancer than non-smokers are.
zh: 吸烟者比不吸烟者更容易患肺癌。

en: If people who smoke are deprived of their cigarettes, they get nervous and irritable.
zh: 如果吸烟者没有烟抽，他们会变得紧张和烦躁。

en: Smokers take twice as many days off sick as non-smokers.
zh: 吸烟者请病假的天数是不吸烟者的两倍。

en: Being in a room full of smokers is my pet peeve.
zh: 在一个满是吸烟者的房间里是我最讨厌的事情。

en: I gave up smoking and I feel like a new man.
zh: 我戒烟了，感觉像换了一个人。

en: The doctor told me to give up smoking.
zh: 医生告诉我戒烟。

en: Please refrain from smoking.
zh: 请勿吸烟。

en: Smoking will do more harm than good.
zh: 吸烟弊大于利。

en: You must give up smoking, as it is unhealthy.
zh: 你必须戒烟，因为它不健康。

en: Smoking may be harmful to his heart.
zh: 吸烟可能对他的心脏有害。

en: Smoking has an ill effect upon health.
zh: 吸烟对健康有不良影响。

en: It is said that smoking is bad for your health.
zh: 据说吸烟对你的健康有害。

en: Smoking is strictly prohibited.
zh: 严禁吸烟。

en: Smoking means suicide.
zh: 吸烟等于自杀。

en: Smoking is now banned on all domestic plane flights.
zh: 现在所有国内航班都禁止吸烟。

en: Smoking is harmful to health.
zh: 吸烟有害健康。

en: Smoking affects your health.
zh: 吸烟影响你的健康。

en: Smoking affects our health.
zh: 吸烟影响我们的健康。

en: Don't forget the fact that smoking is bad for your health.
zh: 别忘了吸烟对你的健康有害。

en: Smoking is bad for the health.
zh: 吸烟对健康有害。

en: Smoking is a danger to your health.
zh: 吸烟对你的健康是一种危害。

en: Smoking will do you a lot of harm.
zh: 吸烟会对你造成很大的伤害。

en: Smoking has a great deal to do with cancer.
zh: 吸烟和癌症有很大关系。

en: It's foolish to think that smoking has little to do with cancer.
zh: 认为吸烟与癌症无关的想法是愚蠢的。

en: Smoking does damage your lungs.
zh: 吸烟确实会损害你的肺。

en: Smoking does you more harm than good.
zh: 吸烟对你弊大于利。

en: Smoking is bad for you.
zh: 吸烟对你不好。

en: The habit of smoking is very difficult to get rid of.
zh: 吸烟的习惯很难改掉。

en: I wish I could break the habit of smoking.
zh: 我希望我能戒掉吸烟的习惯。

en: Smokers are as aware as anybody else of the disadvantages of their hobby, but manage to live with that knowledge for two main reasons.
zh: 吸烟者和其他人一样清楚他们的爱好带来的坏处，但他们设法带着这些知识生活，主要有两个原因。

en: Some people find it easier to grasp the short-term effects of smoking.
zh: 有些人觉得更容易理解吸烟的短期影响。

en: Short-term effects of smoking include unfitness, wheezing, a general vulnerability to illness, bad breath, bad skin and so on.
zh: 吸烟的短期影响包括身体不适、喘息、容易生病、口臭、皮肤不好等等。

en: Most people killed by smoking were not heavy smokers.
zh: 大多数因吸烟而死的人并不是重度吸烟者。

en: Is there a link between smoking and lung cancer?
zh: 吸烟和肺癌之间有联系吗？

en: There is no denying the fact that smoking is harmful.
zh: 不可否认的是，吸烟是有害的。

en: Smoking has affected his lungs.
zh: 吸烟影响了他的肺。

en: Smoking is responsible for many cases of lung cancer.
zh: 吸烟是许多肺癌病例的原因。

en: It is a fact that smoking is bad for health.
zh: 吸烟有害健康是一个事实。

en: It is a fact that smoking is a danger to health.
zh: 吸烟对健康是一种危害，这是一个事实。

en: We have absolute proof that smoking is bad for your health.
zh: 我们有绝对的证据表明吸烟对你的健康有害。

en: Smoking or health, the choice is yours.
zh: 吸烟还是健康，由你选择。

en: Yoshio helped me lift the box up.
zh: 吉雄帮我把箱子抬起来了。

en: Yoshino is a place famous for its cherry blossoms.
zh: 吉野是一个以樱花闻名的地方。

en: Mr Yoshimoto taught us many trivial matters.
zh: 吉本先生教了我们很多琐碎的事情。

en: Mr Yoshida directed me to come at once.
zh: 吉田先生指示我立即来。

en: Mr Yoshida never breaks his promise.
zh: 吉田先生从不违背他的承诺。

en: Mr Yoshida is at home in French history.
zh: 吉田先生精通法国历史。

en: Mr Yoshida is too severe with his children.
zh: 吉田先生对他的孩子们太严厉了。

en: Take your time, Yoshida.
zh: 慢慢来，吉田。

en: Hello, I have a reservation, my name is Kaori Yoshikawa. Here is the confirmation card.
zh: 你好，我有一个预订，我叫吉川香织。这是确认卡。

en: Chrysanthemums smell sweet.
zh: 菊花闻起来很香。

en: Let's carry on the discussion.
zh: 我们继续讨论吧。

en: He is second to none when it comes to debating.
zh: 说到辩论，他无人能及。

en: The discussion was heated.
zh: 讨论很激烈。

en: Discussion is based upon mutual respect.
zh: 讨论是建立在相互尊重的基础上的。

en: The argument ended in a fight.
zh: 争论以打架告终。

en: All the arguments pointed in the same direction.
zh: 所有的论点都指向同一个方向。

en: My argument is indebted in a number of places to the aesthetic theories of Adorno, Horkheimer and others.
zh: 我的论点在很多地方都借鉴了阿多诺、霍克海默等人的美学理论。

en: The essential points of my argument have been expressed in the preceding pages.
zh: 我的论点的要点已经在前面的章节中表达过了。

en: The bell went off right in the middle of our discussion.
zh: 铃声在我们讨论的正中间响了。

en: Let's not argue for the sake of arguing.
zh: 我们不要为了争论而争论。

en: Imagine, for the sake of argument, a tribal group in which mother-son incest was countenanced.
zh: 为了便于讨论，假设有一个部落允许母子乱伦。

en: No one could get the better of him in an argument.
zh: 在辩论中，没有人能胜过他。

en: Women will have the last word.
zh: 女人会是最后发言的人。

en: It is hardly worth discussing.
zh: 这不值得讨论。

en: After they argued, they didn't speak to each other for a week.
zh: 他们吵架后，一个星期没跟对方说话。

en: The discussion produced a great deal of noise, but no forward motion.
zh: 讨论产生了很多噪音，但没有取得任何进展。

en: The chairman rejected his absurd proposal.
zh: 主席否决了他荒谬的提议。

en: The chairman resigned out of the blue.
zh: 主席突然辞职了。

en: The chairperson ordered silence.
zh: 主席命令大家安静。

en: The chairman should take the minority opinion into account.
zh: 主席应该考虑少数人的意见。

en: The chairman would only make her comments off the record.
zh: 主席只会私下发表她的评论。

en: The chairman suggested that we should discuss the problem.
zh: 主席建议我们应该讨论这个问题。

en: The chairman put forward an important plan at the meeting.
zh: 主席在会议上提出了一个重要的计划。

en: The chairman did not rule out the possibility of a disagreement.
zh: 主席没有排除意见不合的可能性。

en: The chairman called the committee to order.
zh: 主席宣布委员会开会。

en: The chairman rejected the proposal.
zh: 主席否决了这项提议。

en: The chairperson has been associated with the organization for ten years.
zh: 主席与该组织有十年的联系。

en: She attended the meeting at the request of the chairman.
zh: 她应主席的要求参加了会议。

en: I would like to nominate Don Jones as chairman.
zh: 我想提名唐·琼斯担任主席。

en: The brunt of criticism was borne by the chairmen.
zh: 批评的主要矛头指向了各位主席。

en: The chairperson cut me short.
zh: 主席打断了我的话。

en: Suppose we change the subject.
zh: 我们换个话题怎么样？

en: Let's proceed with the items on the agenda.
zh: 我们继续讨论议程上的项目吧。

en: I apologize for the delay in sending the agenda.
zh: 我为延迟发送议程而道歉。

en: The bill was eviscerated before being passed by the legislature.
zh: 该法案在立法机构通过之前被大幅修改。

en: It's a sop to Congress.
zh: 这是对国会的一种安抚。

en: Congress went into recess.
zh: 国会休会了。

en: Parliament has been dissolved.
zh: 议会已经解散。

en: Parliament has its beginnings in 14th-century England.
zh: 议会起源于14世纪的英国。

en: Do you know when the first parliament came into being?
zh: 你知道第一个议会是什么时候产生的吗？

en: The bill was passed by an overwhelming majority.
zh: 该法案以压倒性多数获得通过。

en: The chances are that the bill will be rejected.
zh: 该法案很可能会被否决。

en: The bill passed by a small majority of 10 votes.
zh: 该法案以10票的微弱多数获得通过。

en: My sister-in-law had four children in five years.
zh: 我的嫂子在五年内生了四个孩子。

en: It was just polite applause.
zh: 那只是礼貌性的掌声。

en: Try to fulfill your duty.
zh: 尽量履行你的职责。

en: You are not to neglect your duty.
zh: 你不得玩忽职守。

en: You must do your duty.
zh: 你必须履行你的职责。

en: Yoshio said he would pay as much as 15000 yen for a new pair of basketball shoes, but I thought that was quite expensive.
zh: 吉雄说他愿意花15000日元买一双新的篮球鞋，但我认为那太贵了。

en: My brother-in-law is ready to lose his temper at trifles.
zh: 我的姐夫/妹夫/大伯/小叔/姑父/姨夫很容易为小事发脾气。

en: Faith which does not doubt is dead faith.
zh: 没有怀疑的信仰是死的信仰。

en: There's a blind man looking for a shadow of doubt.
zh: 有个瞎子在寻找一丝疑影。

en: There is no room for doubt.
zh: 毫无疑问。

en: One question was what I was going to be.
zh: 一个问题是我将来要做什么。

en: The question is whether Mike knew the fact or not.
zh: 问题是迈克是否知道这件事。

en: It was not what he said, but the way he said it that made me suspicious.
zh: 让我起疑心的不是他说的话，而是他说话的方式。

en: One thing remains doubtful.
zh: 有一件事仍然令人怀疑。

en: Without a doubt!
zh: 毫无疑问！

en: Suspicion is destructive of friendship.
zh: 怀疑会破坏友谊。

en: There is little room for doubt.
zh: 几乎没有怀疑的余地。

en: I feel profound sympathy for the victims.
zh: 我对受害者深表同情。

en: You cannot make omelets without breaking eggs.
zh: 不打碎鸡蛋就做不成煎蛋卷。

en: As to onomatopoetic expressions, we find interesting examples in Hopi.
zh: 至于拟声词，我们在霍皮语中发现了一些有趣的例子。

en: Engineers are crazy about solar energy.
zh: 工程师们对太阳能非常着迷。

en: The engineer seeks not so much to know nature as to make use of it.
zh: 工程师与其说是想了解自然，不如说是想利用自然。

en: The shortage of engineers is the greatest bottleneck to the development of our company.
zh: 工程师短缺是我们公司发展的最大瓶颈。

en: Technological innovation brought about the rapid progress of the information industry.
zh: 技术创新带来了信息产业的快速发展。

en: Thanks to the technological innovation, the maximum output of the factory has doubled.
zh: 由于技术创新，工厂的最大产量翻了一番。

en: The engineer climbed the telephone pole.
zh: 工程师爬上了电线杆。

en: The engineer demonstrated how to operate the sophisticated system.
zh: 工程师演示了如何操作这个复杂的系统。

en: The ceremony began with his speech.
zh: 仪式以他的演讲开始。
